After taking in the stunning views of the Garden of Eden, it's time to move on to the next stop on the Road to Hana: Hamoa Beach. The drive from the Garden of Eden to Hamoa Beach takes about an hour, but the scenic route is worth the time. Once you arrive, you'll find a picturesque crescent-shaped beach with golden sand and crystal-clear waters.

Hamoa Beach is often described as one of the most beautiful beaches in Maui, and it's easy to see why. The natural beauty of the beach and its surroundings is truly breathtaking. It's the perfect spot to relax and unwind, take a refreshing swim in the ocean, or simply bask in the sun while enjoying the company of your furry friend.

Aside from the beach, there are other nearby attractions that you and your pet can explore, such as the Wailua Valley State Wayside, which is a great spot for a picnic, or the nearby Hana Lava Tube, where you can explore a natural wonder of the island.

With its natural beauty and serene atmosphere, Hamoa Beach is a must-visit destination on the Road to Hana. So be sure to add it to your itinerary and create unforgettable memories with your furry friend.

After spending some time at Hamoa Beach, it's time to continue the scenic drive towards Wainapanapa State Park. From Hamoa Beach, the state park is just a 15-minute drive, making it a perfect next stop on your journey.

Wainapanapa State Park is a must-visit location on the Road to Hana, featuring an idyllic black sand beach that's perfect for exploring with your furry friend. This unique beach is surrounded by volcanic rock formations that create a stunning contrast against the deep blue of the ocean. Take a leisurely walk along the beach, dip your toes in the cool water, and enjoy the scenic beauty that this natural wonder has to offer.

Apart from the black sand beach, the park also offers several hiking trails that provide stunning views of the coastline and the park's lush vegetation. One of the most popular trails is the Pa'iloa Beach Trail, which leads you to a hidden cove that's perfect for swimming and picnicking.

If you're a history buff, you'll also appreciate the park's cultural significance. The area was once a burial ground for Hawaiian ali'i, or royalty, and you can still find several ancient Hawaiian structures, such as the caves and rock formations, which have historical and cultural importance.

Overall, Wainapanapa State Park offers a unique and memorable experience that you and your furry companion will surely enjoy. Don't forget to take plenty of photos to capture the stunning beauty of this natural wonder.

After spending some time exploring Wainapanapa State Park, continue your journey by heading towards Hana Farms Roadside. This charming farm stand offers a variety of fresh fruits, vegetables, and other local products that are perfect for a quick snack or picnic lunch. Sample some of the delicious tropical fruits, such as juicy pineapples, sweet mangoes, or creamy avocados, and savor the flavors of the island.

Aside from the fresh produce, Hana Farms Roadside also offers an array of mouthwatering treats and refreshing beverages, including homemade ice cream, smoothies, and juices. Take a break from the scenic drive, grab a bite to eat, and enjoy the rustic charm of this countryside haven.

After indulging in some local flavors, hop back in your car and continue your adventure along the Road to Hana.
